intro: Corallocarpus gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-fruit corallocarpus, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
